trans-unit.source: Endpoint Protection for Windows PCs| Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Endpoint Protection for Windows PCs| Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Secure your managed computers with Endpoint Protection, which provides real-time protection against malware threats.
trans-unit.target: Secure your managed computers with Endpoint Protection, which provides real-time protection against malware threats.

trans-unit.source: Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune can help you to secure your managed computers with Endpoint Protection, which provides real-time protection against malware threats, keeps malware definitions up-to date, and automatically scans computers.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune can help you to secure your managed computers with Endpoint Protection, which provides real-time protection against malware threats, keeps malware definitions up-to date, and automatically scans computers.

trans-unit.source: Endpoint Protection also provides tools that help you to manage and monitor malware attacks.
trans-unit.target: Endpoint Protection also provides tools that help you to manage and monitor malware attacks.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet installed the Intune client on your computers, see [Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune](install-the-windows-pc-client-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet installed the Intune client on your computers, see [Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune](install-the-windows-pc-client-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you configure, deploy, and monitor Endpoint Protection.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you configure, deploy, and monitor Endpoint Protection.

trans-unit.source: Choose when to use Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Choose when to use Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: As an IT admin, one of your top priorities is keeping the computers that you manage free of malware and viruses.
trans-unit.target: As an IT admin, one of your top priorities is keeping the computers that you manage free of malware and viruses.

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy Intune to Windows PCs in your organization, you should decide how to protect your computers by selecting one of the following options and configuring its associated policy settings:
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy Intune to Windows PCs in your organization, you should decide how to protect your computers by selecting one of the following options and configuring its associated policy settings:

trans-unit.source: You want to:
trans-unit.target: You want to:

trans-unit.source: Endpoint Protection policy settings
trans-unit.target: Endpoint Protection policy settings

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection only if no third-party endpoint protection application is installed.
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection only if no third-party endpoint protection application is installed.

trans-unit.source: You can use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection on all computers where a third-party endpoint protection application is not installed.
trans-unit.target: You can use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection on all computers where a third-party endpoint protection application is not installed.

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection = **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection = **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Enable Endpoint Protection = **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Enable Endpoint Protection = **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = **No**
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = **No**

trans-unit.source: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is not installed, and is uninstalled if it was installed previously.
trans-unit.target: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is not installed, and is uninstalled if it was installed previously.

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed.
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed.

trans-unit.source: With this approach, you will be running Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection and the third-party endpoint protection application simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: With this approach, you will be running Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection and the third-party endpoint protection application simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Because of potential performance issues, we don't recommend this configuration.
trans-unit.target: Because of potential performance issues, we don't recommend this configuration.

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection = **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection = **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Enable Endpoint Protection = **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Enable Endpoint Protection = **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Use when:
trans-unit.target: Use when:

trans-unit.source: - You want to switch to using Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.
trans-unit.target: - You want to switch to using Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.

trans-unit.source: - You deploy a new client that will use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.
trans-unit.target: - You deploy a new client that will use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.

trans-unit.source: - You upgrade any client that will use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.
trans-unit.target: - You upgrade any client that will use Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.

trans-unit.source: Use Intune without Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.
trans-unit.target: Use Intune without Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you will rely on a third-party endpoint protection application.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you will rely on a third-party endpoint protection application.

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection = **No**
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection = **No**

trans-unit.source: If you are not using a third-party endpoint protection application, this configuration is not recommended, because it could expose your organization’s computers to malware or other attacks.
trans-unit.target: If you are not using a third-party endpoint protection application, this configuration is not recommended, because it could expose your organization’s computers to malware or other attacks.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is not installed, and is uninstalled if it was installed previously.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is not installed, and is uninstalled if it was installed previously.

trans-unit.source: To switch from your current endpoint protection application to Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To switch from your current endpoint protection application to Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Leave your current endpoint protection application running while you deploy the Intune client software to those computers.
trans-unit.target: Leave your current endpoint protection application running while you deploy the Intune client software to those computers.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is installed and is helping to secure client computers.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is installed and is helping to secure client computers.

trans-unit.source: Remove the third-party endpoint protection software by:
trans-unit.target: Remove the third-party endpoint protection software by:

trans-unit.source: Using Intune software distribution to deploy a software removal tool that's provided by the manufacturer of the third-party endpoint protection application.
trans-unit.target: Using Intune software distribution to deploy a software removal tool that's provided by the manufacturer of the third-party endpoint protection application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy apps with Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy apps with Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Removing the third-party endpoint protection application manually.
trans-unit.target: Removing the third-party endpoint protection application manually.

trans-unit.source: Intune will not automatically uninstall third-party endpoint protection applications.
trans-unit.target: Intune will not automatically uninstall third-party endpoint protection applications.

trans-unit.source: Configure Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Configure Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to help you configure Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to help you configure Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Computer Management**, and then select **Microsoft Intune Agent Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Computer Management**, and then select **Microsoft Intune Agent Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Create and Deploy a Custom Policy** to specify a policy for Endpoint Protection settings.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create and Deploy a Custom Policy** to specify a policy for Endpoint Protection settings.

trans-unit.source: Then choose the **Create Policy** button.
trans-unit.target: Then choose the **Create Policy** button.

trans-unit.source: You can use the recommended settings or customize the settings.
trans-unit.target: You can use the recommended settings or customize the settings.

trans-unit.source: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the topic [Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client](common-windows-pc-management-tasks-with-the-microsoft-intune-computer-client.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the topic [Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client](common-windows-pc-management-tasks-with-the-microsoft-intune-computer-client.md).

trans-unit.source: Endpoint Protection settings
trans-unit.target: Endpoint Protection settings

trans-unit.source: You can view the deployed Endpoint Protection policy on the **All Policies** page of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: You can view the deployed Endpoint Protection policy on the **All Policies** page of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Specify Endpoint Protection service settings
trans-unit.target: Specify Endpoint Protection service settings

trans-unit.source: Policy setting
trans-unit.target: Policy setting

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to install Endpoint Protection on managed computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to install Endpoint Protection on managed computers.

trans-unit.source: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected during installation, Endpoint Protection will not be installed unless the setting **Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed** is set to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected during installation, Endpoint Protection will not be installed unless the setting **Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed** is set to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** Intune Endpoint Protection is installed on managed computers by default.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** Intune Endpoint Protection is installed on managed computers by default.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t want to install Endpoint Protection on your managed computers, you must explicitly set this policy to **No**.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t want to install Endpoint Protection on your managed computers, you must explicitly set this policy to **No**.

trans-unit.source: If Endpoint Protection was previously installed and the policy is updated to **No**, then the Endpoint Protection client will be uninstalled.
trans-unit.target: If Endpoint Protection was previously installed and the policy is updated to **No**, then the Endpoint Protection client will be uninstalled.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to install Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to install Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Enable Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Enable Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to enable Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection on computers that have the Endpoint Protection client.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to enable Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection on computers that have the Endpoint Protection client.

trans-unit.source: If set to **No**, and Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is installed, the Endpoint Protection client user interface is not displayed to users, and all protection features are inactive.
trans-unit.target: If set to **No**, and Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection is installed, the Endpoint Protection client user interface is not displayed to users, and all protection features are inactive.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Disable Client UI
trans-unit.target: Disable Client UI

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to hide the Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection client user interface from users (requires a client computer restart to take effect).
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to hide the Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection client user interface from users (requires a client computer restart to take effect).

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed
trans-unit.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to force the installation of Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to force the installation of Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection, even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Create a system restore point before malware remediation
trans-unit.target: Create a system restore point before malware remediation

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to create a Windows System Restore Point before any malware remediation begins.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to create a Windows System Restore Point before any malware remediation begins.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Track resolved malware (days)
trans-unit.target: Track resolved malware (days)

trans-unit.source: Enables Endpoint Protection to track resolved malware for a specified time so that you can manually check previously infected computers.
trans-unit.target: Enables Endpoint Protection to track resolved malware for a specified time so that you can manually check previously infected computers.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a value from 0 to 30 days.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a value from 0 to 30 days.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **7 days**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **7 days**

trans-unit.source: If you have set the policy values for the settings **Install Endpoint Protection** and **Enable Endpoint Protection** to **Yes**, and the policy value for **Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed** to **No**, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection detects that another endpoint protection application is installed.
trans-unit.target: If you have set the policy values for the settings **Install Endpoint Protection** and **Enable Endpoint Protection** to **Yes**, and the policy value for **Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed** to **No**, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection detects that another endpoint protection application is installed.

trans-unit.source: This means that Endpoint Protection won't be installed, or will be uninstalled if it is already present.
trans-unit.target: This means that Endpoint Protection won't be installed, or will be uninstalled if it is already present.

trans-unit.source: However, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection does report about the health of the other endpoint protection application in Intune.
trans-unit.target: However, Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection does report about the health of the other endpoint protection application in Intune.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Security Essentials alerts you with real-time protection when potential threats such as viruses and spyware are trying to install themselves or run on your PC.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Security Essentials alerts you with real-time protection when potential threats such as viruses and spyware are trying to install themselves or run on your PC.

trans-unit.source: The moment this happens, you’ll see a message in the notification area to the right side of the taskbar.
trans-unit.target: The moment this happens, you’ll see a message in the notification area to the right side of the taskbar.

trans-unit.source: Specify real-time protection settings
trans-unit.target: Specify real-time protection settings

trans-unit.source: Policy setting
trans-unit.target: Policy setting

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Enable real-time protection
trans-unit.target: Enable real-time protection

trans-unit.source: Enables monitoring and scanning of all files and applications that are accessed.
trans-unit.target: Enables monitoring and scanning of all files and applications that are accessed.

trans-unit.source: It also blocks any malicious files and applications before they can run on computers.
trans-unit.target: It also blocks any malicious files and applications before they can run on computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Scan all downloads
trans-unit.target: Scan all downloads

trans-unit.source: Enables the scanning of all files and attachments that are downloaded from the Internet to computers.
trans-unit.target: Enables the scanning of all files and attachments that are downloaded from the Internet to computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Monitor file and program activity on computers
trans-unit.target: Monitor file and program activity on computers

trans-unit.source: Enables the monitoring of incoming and outgoing files, and program activity on computers.
trans-unit.target: Enables the monitoring of incoming and outgoing files, and program activity on computers.

trans-unit.source: With this setting, Endpoint Protection can monitor when files and programs start to run and alert you about any actions they perform or actions that are taken on them.
trans-unit.target: With this setting, Endpoint Protection can monitor when files and programs start to run and alert you about any actions they perform or actions that are taken on them.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Files monitored
trans-unit.target: Files monitored

trans-unit.source: Enables you to choose if only incoming, only outgoing, or all files are monitored.
trans-unit.target: Enables you to choose if only incoming, only outgoing, or all files are monitored.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Monitor all files**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Monitor all files**

trans-unit.source: Enable behavior monitoring
trans-unit.target: Enable behavior monitoring

trans-unit.source: Enables Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection to check for certain patterns of suspicious activity on client computers.
trans-unit.target: Enables Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection to check for certain patterns of suspicious activity on client computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Enable Network Inspection System
trans-unit.target: Enable Network Inspection System

trans-unit.source: Enables Network Inspection System (NIS) on client computers.
trans-unit.target: Enables Network Inspection System (NIS) on client computers.

trans-unit.source: NIS uses signatures of known vulnerabilities from the [Microsoft Malware Protection Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=234249) to help detect and block malicious network traffic.
trans-unit.target: NIS uses signatures of known vulnerabilities from the [Microsoft Malware Protection Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=234249) to help detect and block malicious network traffic.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Real-time settings for Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Real-time settings for Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: Specify scan schedule settings
trans-unit.target: Specify scan schedule settings

trans-unit.source: Policy setting
trans-unit.target: Policy setting

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Schedule a daily quick scan
trans-unit.target: Schedule a daily quick scan

trans-unit.source: Schedules a daily quick scan of both frequently used files and important system files on computers.
trans-unit.target: Schedules a daily quick scan of both frequently used files and important system files on computers.

trans-unit.source: This quick scan has a minimal effect on performance.
trans-unit.target: This quick scan has a minimal effect on performance.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Run a quick scan if you have missed two consecutive scans
trans-unit.target: Run a quick scan if you have missed two consecutive scans

trans-unit.source: Configures Endpoint Protection to automatically run a quick scan on computers if they have missed two consecutive quick scans.
trans-unit.target: Configures Endpoint Protection to automatically run a quick scan on computers if they have missed two consecutive quick scans.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Schedule a full scan
trans-unit.target: Schedule a full scan

trans-unit.source: Configures a full scan of all files and resources on the local computer hard disks.
trans-unit.target: Configures a full scan of all files and resources on the local computer hard disks.

trans-unit.source: This scan can take time and can affect computer performance (the amount time it takes depends on the number of files and resources that are scanned).
trans-unit.target: This scan can take time and can affect computer performance (the amount time it takes depends on the number of files and resources that are scanned).

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Run a full scan if you have missed two consecutive full scans
trans-unit.target: Run a full scan if you have missed two consecutive full scans

trans-unit.source: Configures Endpoint Protection to automatically run a full scan on computers if they have missed two consecutive scans.
trans-unit.target: Configures Endpoint Protection to automatically run a full scan on computers if they have missed two consecutive scans.

trans-unit.source: Recommend value: Not configured
trans-unit.target: Recommend value: Not configured

trans-unit.source: Specify scan options settings
trans-unit.target: Specify scan options settings

trans-unit.source: Policy setting
trans-unit.target: Policy setting

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Run a full scan after installation of Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Run a full scan after installation of Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically run a full system scan after it is installed on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically run a full system scan after it is installed on computers.

trans-unit.source: This scan runs only when computers are idle to minimize the effect on user productivity.
trans-unit.target: This scan runs only when computers are idle to minimize the effect on user productivity.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Automatically run a full scan when needed to follow up malware removal
trans-unit.target: Automatically run a full scan when needed to follow up malware removal

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically run a full system scan on computers after the removal of malware to help confirm that other files were not affected.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically run a full system scan on computers after the removal of malware to help confirm that other files were not affected.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Start a scheduled scan only when the computer is idle
trans-unit.target: Start a scheduled scan only when the computer is idle

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to prevent scheduled scans from starting when computers are in use to prevent any loss of user productivity.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to prevent scheduled scans from starting when computers are in use to prevent any loss of user productivity.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Check for the latest malware definitions before starting a scan
trans-unit.target: Check for the latest malware definitions before starting a scan

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically check for the latest malware definitions before it starts a scan on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to let Endpoint Protection automatically check for the latest malware definitions before it starts a scan on computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Scan archive files
trans-unit.target: Scan archive files

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan for malware in archive files (like .zip or .cab files) on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan for malware in archive files (like .zip or .cab files) on computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Scan email messages
trans-unit.target: Scan email messages

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan incoming email messages when they arrive on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan incoming email messages when they arrive on computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Scan files opened from network shared folders
trans-unit.target: Scan files opened from network shared folders

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan files that are opened from shared folders on the network.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan files that are opened from shared folders on the network.

trans-unit.source: These are typically files that are accessed by using a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path.
trans-unit.target: These are typically files that are accessed by using a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path.

trans-unit.source: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.
trans-unit.target: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Scan mapped network drives
trans-unit.target: Scan mapped network drives

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan files on mapped network drives.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan files on mapped network drives.

trans-unit.source: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.
trans-unit.target: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **No**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **No**

trans-unit.source: Scan removable drives
trans-unit.target: Scan removable drives

trans-unit.source: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan for malware and unwanted software on removable drives, like USB flash drives, when you run a full scan on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set to **Yes** to configure Endpoint Protection to scan for malware and unwanted software on removable drives, like USB flash drives, when you run a full scan on computers.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Yes**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Yes**

trans-unit.source: Limit CPU usage during a scan
trans-unit.target: Limit CPU usage during a scan

trans-unit.source: Set the maximum percentage of CPU usage that can be used during scheduled scans on computers.
trans-unit.target: Set the maximum percentage of CPU usage that can be used during scheduled scans on computers.

trans-unit.source: You can set this value from 1 to 100 percent.
trans-unit.target: You can set this value from 1 to 100 percent.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **50%**
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **50%**

trans-unit.source: Choose default actions settings
trans-unit.target: Choose default actions settings

trans-unit.source: The setting **Choose how Endpoint Protection acts on malware of the following alert levels** specifies the default action that Endpoint Protection takes when malware of various alert levels is detected.
trans-unit.target: The setting **Choose how Endpoint Protection acts on malware of the following alert levels** specifies the default action that Endpoint Protection takes when malware of various alert levels is detected.

trans-unit.source: For each alert level, you can remove the malware, quarantine it, or take Microsoft’s recommended action.
trans-unit.target: For each alert level, you can remove the malware, quarantine it, or take Microsoft’s recommended action.

trans-unit.source: Recommended value: **Recommended action**, which enables Endpoint Protection to recommend action.
trans-unit.target: Recommended value: **Recommended action**, which enables Endpoint Protection to recommend action.

trans-unit.source: Decide whether to choose the excluded files and folders settings
trans-unit.target: Decide whether to choose the excluded files and folders settings

trans-unit.source: The setting **Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** excludes specific files or folders when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.
trans-unit.target: The setting **Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** excludes specific files or folders when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.

trans-unit.source: Decide whether to choose the excluded processes settings
trans-unit.target: Decide whether to choose the excluded processes settings

trans-unit.source: The setting **Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** lets you exclude specific processes when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.
trans-unit.target: The setting **Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** lets you exclude specific processes when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.

trans-unit.source: You can exclude only files with the following extensions: **.exe**, **.com**, or **.scr**.
trans-unit.target: You can exclude only files with the following extensions: **.exe**, **.com**, or **.scr**.

trans-unit.source: Decide whether to choose the excluded file types settings
trans-unit.target: Decide whether to choose the excluded file types settings

trans-unit.source: The setting **File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** lets you exclude specific file name extensions when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.
trans-unit.target: The setting **File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection** lets you exclude specific file name extensions when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.

trans-unit.source: Specify Microsoft Active Protection Service Settings
trans-unit.target: Specify Microsoft Active Protection Service Settings

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Active Protection Service is an online community that helps you decide how to respond to potential threats.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Active Protection Service is an online community that helps you decide how to respond to potential threats.

trans-unit.source: The community also helps stop the spread of new malware infections.
trans-unit.target: The community also helps stop the spread of new malware infections.

trans-unit.source: You can **Join Microsoft Active Protection Service** by selecting **Yes**, and then specifying your **Membership Level**:
trans-unit.target: You can **Join Microsoft Active Protection Service** by selecting **Yes**, and then specifying your **Membership Level**:

trans-unit.source: **Basic** - Sends basic information to Microsoft about detected malware.
trans-unit.target: **Basic** - Sends basic information to Microsoft about detected malware.

trans-unit.source: This includes where the software came from, the actions that you apply or that Endpoint Protection applies automatically, and whether the actions were successful.
trans-unit.target: This includes where the software came from, the actions that you apply or that Endpoint Protection applies automatically, and whether the actions were successful.

trans-unit.source: **Advanced** - Sends more information to Microsoft about malware, spyware, and potentially unwanted software.
trans-unit.target: **Advanced** - Sends more information to Microsoft about malware, spyware, and potentially unwanted software.

trans-unit.source: This includes information about the location of the software, file names, how the software operates, and how it has affected your computer.
trans-unit.target: This includes information about the location of the software, file names, how the software operates, and how it has affected your computer.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Receive dynamic definitions based on Microsoft Active Protection Service reports**.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Receive dynamic definitions based on Microsoft Active Protection Service reports**.

trans-unit.source: Choose management tasks for Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Choose management tasks for Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: The following tasks help you to carry out various management tasks on managed computers that run Endpoint Protection:
trans-unit.target: The following tasks help you to carry out various management tasks on managed computers that run Endpoint Protection:

trans-unit.source: Update malware definitions
trans-unit.target: Update malware definitions

trans-unit.source: Intune console - From the **Groups** workspace, select the computers that you want to update.
trans-unit.target: Intune console - From the **Groups** workspace, select the computers that you want to update.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Remote Tasks** > **Update Malware Definitions**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Remote Tasks** > **Update Malware Definitions**.

trans-unit.source: Managed computer - Start the Endpoint Protection client software from the Windows notification area.
trans-unit.target: Managed computer - Start the Endpoint Protection client software from the Windows notification area.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Update** tab, and then choose **Update**.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Update** tab, and then choose **Update**.

trans-unit.source: Run a malware scan:
trans-unit.target: Run a malware scan:

trans-unit.source: Intune console - From the **Groups** workspace, select the computers that you want to scan.
trans-unit.target: Intune console - From the **Groups** workspace, select the computers that you want to scan.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Run a Full Malware Scan** or **Run a Quick Malware Scan**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Run a Full Malware Scan** or **Run a Quick Malware Scan**.

trans-unit.source: Managed computer - Start the Endpoint Protection client software from the Windows notification area.
trans-unit.target: Managed computer - Start the Endpoint Protection client software from the Windows notification area.

trans-unit.source: Select **Quick**, **Full**, or **Custom**, and then choose **Scan now**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Quick**, **Full**, or **Custom**, and then choose **Scan now**.

trans-unit.source: You can view the status of a remote task by choosing the **Remote Tasks** link in the bottom right corner of the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: You can view the status of a remote task by choosing the **Remote Tasks** link in the bottom right corner of the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: The **Remote Task Status** dialog box lists current remote tasks, task status, device name, and any reported errors.
trans-unit.target: The **Remote Task Status** dialog box lists current remote tasks, task status, device name, and any reported errors.

trans-unit.source: It also provides a link to troubleshooting information, if appropriate.
trans-unit.target: It also provides a link to troubleshooting information, if appropriate.

trans-unit.source: Monitor Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Monitor Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: You monitor the status of malware on your computers by using the **Protection** workspace of the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/).
trans-unit.target: You monitor the status of malware on your computers by using the **Protection** workspace of the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/).

trans-unit.source: This workspace contains two pages:
trans-unit.target: This workspace contains two pages:

trans-unit.source: **Protection Overview** -Displays important issues as links that you can choose for more information.
trans-unit.target: **Protection Overview** -Displays important issues as links that you can choose for more information.

trans-unit.source: Issues that might be displayed include:
trans-unit.target: Issues that might be displayed include:

trans-unit.source: **Malware instances that need follow-up** – Click the link to see a list of malware issues, including the follow-up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.
trans-unit.target: **Malware instances that need follow-up** – Click the link to see a list of malware issues, including the follow-up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.

trans-unit.source: You can further explore this list to see which computers are affected.
trans-unit.target: You can further explore this list to see which computers are affected.

trans-unit.source: **Computers with malware that need follow-up** – Click the link to see all computers with unresolved malware issues, as well as the follow-up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.
trans-unit.target: **Computers with malware that need follow-up** – Click the link to see all computers with unresolved malware issues, as well as the follow-up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.

trans-unit.source: **Devices that are not protected** – Click the link to see computers that are not protected by any endpoint protection software, either because no software is installed, or because there is an error.
trans-unit.target: **Devices that are not protected** – Click the link to see computers that are not protected by any endpoint protection software, either because no software is installed, or because there is an error.

trans-unit.source: Select a computer to view more details.
trans-unit.target: Select a computer to view more details.

trans-unit.source: **Devices with another endpoint protection application running** – Click the link to see computers that are running a third-party endpoint protection application.
trans-unit.target: **Devices with another endpoint protection application running** – Click the link to see computers that are running a third-party endpoint protection application.

trans-unit.source: **All Malware** - Displays a list of all active malware that's found on your computers.
trans-unit.target: **All Malware** - Displays a list of all active malware that's found on your computers.

trans-unit.source: You can explore this list to see all computers that are affected by a particular piece of malware, or you can select one of the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: You can explore this list to see all computers that are affected by a particular piece of malware, or you can select one of the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: **View Properties** – Opens a page with more information about the selected malware.
trans-unit.target: **View Properties** – Opens a page with more information about the selected malware.

trans-unit.source: **Learn About This Malware** – Opens a topic from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center with more information about the malware.
trans-unit.target: **Learn About This Malware** – Opens a topic from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center with more information about the malware.

trans-unit.source: The **Protection** workspace is not displayed in the administration console until you have installed the client and are managing at least one computer client.
trans-unit.target: The **Protection** workspace is not displayed in the administration console until you have installed the client and are managing at least one computer client.

trans-unit.source: Monitor Endpoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Monitor Endpoint Protection

trans-unit.source: How to view Recent Detection Paths for malware on computers
trans-unit.target: How to view Recent Detection Paths for malware on computers

trans-unit.source: Intune can display the paths of up to 10 of the most recently detected instances of malware on a device.
trans-unit.target: Intune can display the paths of up to 10 of the most recently detected instances of malware on a device.

trans-unit.source: The **Recent Detection Path** is disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: The **Recent Detection Path** is disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: To enable this view:
trans-unit.target: To enable this view:

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Groups** > **All Devices** > **Malware**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Groups** > **All Devices** > **Malware**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click a column header.
trans-unit.target: Right-click a column header.

trans-unit.source: A list of available columns appears.
trans-unit.target: A list of available columns appears.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Recent Detection Paths** check box in the list.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Recent Detection Paths** check box in the list.

trans-unit.source: The **Recent Detection Paths** column appears and displays up to 10 of the most recently monitored malware instances on the device.
trans-unit.target: The **Recent Detection Paths** column appears and displays up to 10 of the most recently monitored malware instances on the device.

trans-unit.source: Run a malware scan or update malware definitions on a computer
trans-unit.target: Run a malware scan or update malware definitions on a computer

trans-unit.source: Intune can run either a full or quick malware scan by using Endpoint Protection or Windows Defender on a remotely managed PC that has the Intune client installed.
trans-unit.target: Intune can run either a full or quick malware scan by using Endpoint Protection or Windows Defender on a remotely managed PC that has the Intune client installed.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), go to **Groups** > **Overview** > **All Devices** > **All Computers**, and then select the computer that you want to target.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), go to **Groups** > **Overview** > **All Devices** > **All Computers**, and then select the computer that you want to target.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Remote Tasks** drop-down list, and then select the task to run on the remote computer.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Remote Tasks** drop-down list, and then select the task to run on the remote computer.

trans-unit.source: Need more help?
trans-unit.target: Need more help?

trans-unit.source: For further help and support, see [Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-endpoint-protection-in-microsoft-intune).
trans-unit.target: For further help and support, see [Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-endpoint-protection-in-microsoft-intune).

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: Policies to protect Windows PCs
trans-unit.target: Policies to protect Windows PCs
